I have an entry from July 2003 in my private journal that is titled â€œADHDâ€ and is just one line:

Could this be what I have? http://slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=03/07/24/2355245

I got distracted yâ€™know and completely forgot about it until I went looking for info on how my partner got their diagnosis last year, which is what prompted me to look into whether Iâ€™ve got the same thing. Today, it was officially confirmed that I do. ADHD: combined presentation. â€œCombinedâ€ meaning a mix of both the â€œinattentiveâ€ and the â€œimpulsive/hyperactiveâ€ presentations (types). I think of it as â€œjust all over the place, man ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸â€.

Iâ€™m relieved to have something Iâ€™ve been fairly certain about for a year acknowledged â€˜officiallyâ€™, and to be able to get medication that could help me function better day-to-day. Iâ€™m also annoyed that it took 20 years.

But I guess â€œconsistently putting off getting important things done and feeling really bad about itâ€ is ADHD? Iâ€™m just starting out on this path, so I donâ€™t know. I do know that if I donâ€™t post something about it today, while Iâ€™m still riding that dopamine high, that I wonâ€™t post about it for a while, cause itâ€™s all gonna start feeling like work tomorrow. I do want to write more about how I got here, but just thinking about it is overwhelming and making me want to run away switch tabs check social media. Lemme get medicated first, ok? Itâ€™s coming, promise.

Iâ€™ll drop a few links here to articles that I read in the past year from folks who are also in the software engineering world, which I appreciated, because they either made me feel less crazy or provided concrete techniques that helped me cope, or both:

  • Leigh Honeywellâ€™s toolbox post + two levels of links therein.
    • ADHD â€“ A Lifelong Struggle was one of the links that particularly resonated. I think I have a much milder version, but so many behaviours the author was vulnerable enough to share had me nodding.
  • Jamie Tannaâ€™s post
  • Glyphâ€™s â€œLeave the Frog for Lastâ€, which is not a â€œcoming outâ€ post, but was really helpful for me. Iâ€™ve spent a lot of my life dancing around frogs that I couldnâ€™t bear to think about, never mind eat.

The irony of this post coming months after the last one isnâ€™t lost on me. To be fair, I think itâ€™s less of an ADHD thing (although itâ€™s always a factor!), and more of just the past three months sucking, and me still not being in a place where Iâ€™m willing to share those kinds of details publicly.

In a demonstration of how Iâ€™m embracing my jumping-all-over-the-place brain, apropos nothing, hereâ€™re some pictures from a couple of bike rides around Kempenfelt Bay I took so far this spring. The last three are from today:
